intro: Rudgea monofructus, commonly known as the single-fruited rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruit is a unique, single-seeded capsule that splits open to release its seed. Rudgea monofructus is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
